content:
Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language created by Guido van Rossum in 1991. It emphasizes code readability with significant use of whitespace. Python supports multiple programming paradigms including procedural, object-oriented, and functional programming.

Python is dynamically typed and garbage-collected. It has a comprehensive standard library and is often described as a 'batteries included' language due to its extensive modules and packages.

Common use cases for Python include web development (Django, Flask), data analysis (pandas, NumPy), machine learning (scikit-learn, TensorFlow), automation, and scripting.

Product Pricing Structure (2024)

Starter Plan: $29/month
- Up to 5 users
- 10GB storage
- Email support
- Basic analytics

Professional Plan: $99/month
- Up to 25 users
- 100GB storage
- Priority email support
- Advanced analytics
- API access

Enterprise Plan: Custom pricing
- Unlimited users
- Unlimited storage
- 24/7 phone support
- Custom integrations
- Dedicated account manager
- SLA guarantee

All plans include a 14-day free trial. Annual subscriptions receive a 20% discount.

Q4 2023 Financial Results

Revenue: $2.5 million (up 35% YoY)
Gross Margin: 72%
Operating Expenses: $1.2 million
Net Income: $500,000

Key Highlights:
- Customer base grew to 1,200 companies
- Average contract value increased to $15,000 annually
- Launched 3 major product features
- Expanded into European market (UK, Germany, France)
- Team grew from 45 to 60 employees

Looking ahead to Q1 2024:
- Expected revenue: $2.8-3.0 million
- Planned product launches: Mobile app, API v2
- Hiring: 10 additional engineers and 5 sales reps

Employee Handbook - Time Off Policies

Vacation Days:
- New employees: 15 days per year
- After 2 years: 20 days per year
- After 5 years: 25 days per year

Sick Leave:
- Unlimited sick days (with manager approval)
- Doctor's note required for absences over 3 consecutive days

Holidays:
- 10 paid company holidays
- Office closed between December 24-31

Parental Leave:
- Primary caregiver: 16 weeks paid
- Secondary caregiver: 6 weeks paid

Remote Work:
- Hybrid policy: minimum 2 days in office per week
- Fully remote available for approved roles
- Must maintain regular business hours (9am-5pm local time)

API Documentation - Authentication

All API requests require authentication using API keys. To authenticate:

1. Generate an API key in your dashboard under Settings > API Keys
2. Include the key in request headers:
   Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY

Endpoints:

GET /api/v1/users
- Retrieve list of users
- Parameters: limit (default: 50), offset (default: 0)
- Response: JSON array of user objects

POST /api/v1/users
- Create new user
- Required fields: email, name
- Optional fields: role, department
- Response: Created user object with ID

GET /api/v1/users/{id}
- Retrieve specific user by ID
- Response: User object or 404 if not found

DELETE /api/v1/users/{id}
- Delete user (requires admin role)
- Response: 204 No Content on success

Rate Limits:
- 1000 requests per hour per API key
- Headers include: X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Reset

Introduction to Machine Learning

Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence that enables systems to learn and improve from experience without being explicitly programmed. There are three main types:

1. Supervised Learning:
   - Model learns from labeled training data
   - Examples: classification, regression
   - Algorithms: linear regression, decision trees, neural networks
   - Use cases: spam detection, price prediction

2. Unsupervised Learning:
   - Model finds patterns in unlabeled data
   - Examples: clustering, dimensionality reduction
   - Algorithms: K-means, PCA, autoencoders
   - Use cases: customer segmentation, anomaly detection

3. Reinforcement Learning:
   - Model learns through trial and error with rewards
   - Examples: game playing, robotics
   - Algorithms: Q-learning, policy gradients
   - Use cases: AlphaGo, autonomous driving

Key concepts:
- Training set: Data used to train the model
- Test set: Data used to evaluate model performance
- Overfitting: Model performs well on training data but poorly on new data
- Cross-validation: Technique to assess model generalization
